translation: Good people with good reputation, good appearance, good form, good characteristics, good words, and good qualities cultivated can bow into the palace; who would dare to make it difficult?

source_sentence: 其守門人既奉王命，報阿難陀曰：「王屈入宮。」
translation: The guard at the gate obeyed the king's order and reported to Ānanda, The king bends into the palace.

source_sentence: 其時四方國使亦與同入。
translation: At the time, the envoys of the four directions also entered with him.

source_sentence: 時阿難陀啟王：「無病。」
translation: Ānanda then asked the king, There's no illness.

translation: He sat at one side and said to the king Candracchattra, “The World-honored One extended his greetings and sent a message to the great king, saying:

translation: Now, I want to follow it and let the king know about it.'

translation: Is food and drink plentiful?

source_sentence: 時諸國使咸啟王言：「王甚無道，既能請佛聲聞僧伽興設供養，於三月日，
translation: The envoys of the various countries said to the king, “Your majesty, a man of little learning, invited the Buddha śrāvakas and sanghas to make offerings on the thirty-threeth day.

source_sentence: 自住密宮而不見謁。
translation: He stayed in the secret palace himself but didn't see the audience.

source_sentence: 世尊在境，一夏已來食麁馬麥。」
translation: The Bhagavān is in the realm, and he's been eating uncooked horse wheat for a summer.

source_sentence: 王曰：「聖者阿難陀！
translation: The king said, Sage Ānanda!

source_sentence: 世尊僧伽於三月日，實喫麁麥耶？」
translation: Bhagavān, did the saṃgha really eat wheat on the day of the third month?

source_sentence: 阿難陀曰：「誠如所說。」
translation: Ānanda said, It's exactly as you say.

source_sentence: 王便悶絕，從座而倒，冷水洒面，方得醒悟，喚諸臣佐，告曰：「我先勅令每日供膳五百人食，
translation: The king fainted in distress and withdrew from his seat. He washed his face with cool water and then awoke. He summoned his ministers, saying: I have previously instructed you to provide food for five hundred people every day.

source_sentence: 種種精妙，甘美香饌，羹飯飲食耶？」
translation: What are the various kinds of exquisite, sweet, fragrant, and delicious foods and drinks?

source_sentence: 諸聖答言：「大王但令遣造香饌，不命臣等應合與誰？
translation: The sages replied, Great king, you simply ordered me to send incense and delicacies, but you didn't order my ministers to give them to whom?

source_sentence: 臣等奉勅每日供膳，造五百人分。」
translation: Each day, we ministers were instructed to prepare a meal for five hundred people.

source_sentence: 時火授王詣世尊所頂禮佛足，退坐一面。
translation: King火授 then went to the Bhagavān, bowed his head and feet at the Buddha's feet, withdrew, and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 世尊為彼，說微妙法，示教利喜，默然而住。
translation: The World-honored One taught them the subtle Dharma for their sake, encouraging, benefiting, and delighting them. They remained in silence.

source_sentence: 王從座起，復禮佛足，白言：「世尊！
translation: The king rose from his seat, bowed at the Buddha's feet, and said, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我有深過。
translation: I have profound faults.

source_sentence: 大德善逝！
translation: Bhagavān, the great virtuous one!

source_sentence: 我有深過。
translation: I have profound faults.

translation: Because I am ignorant and ignorant as a child, not distinguished from the good and the wise, lacking in skillful means, I first invited the World-honored One and the śrāvakas to spend the rains retreat on the third day of the month.

source_sentence: 便住深宮而不見佛，唯願世尊證知護念，哀愍於我，受我追悔，見容其過。」
translation: They then stayed in the deep palace and didn't see the Buddha, so may the Bhagavān realize that they are guarding their mindfulness, have pity for me, receive my repentance, and tolerate their faults.

source_sentence: 佛言：「大王！
translation: The Buddha said, Great king!

source_sentence: 誠如王說，親請世尊及僧伽眾，於三月日而不來現，實為幼少愚癡，不別良賢，
translation: In truth, just as the king said, he invited the World-honored One and the assembly of monks. He did not appear on the thirty-threeth day [of the seventh month]. It is really because the youthful foolish man was so ignorant that he did not distinguish himself from the eminent scholars.

source_sentence: 闕諸善巧。
translation: They lack the skillful means.

source_sentence: 然大王當知！
translation: Still, great king, you should know!

source_sentence: 若人造過，深生自悔，其罪自滅，福德增長。
translation: If someone commits a sin and deeply regrets it, their sin will cease on its own, and merit will increase.

source_sentence: 何因緣故？
translation: What are the reasons for this?

source_sentence: 由見過罪，能生追悔。」
translation: By seeing faults and sins, they can give rise to remorse.

source_sentence: 王復白佛：「唯願世尊與苾芻僧伽，盡形受我衣服、飲食、臥具、湯藥。」
translation: The king then said to the Buddha, May the Bhagavān and the monks and nuns accept my clothing, food and drink, bedding, and medicine in full form.

source_sentence: 佛言：「大王！
translation: The Buddha said, Great king!

source_sentence: 壽命促時，如來出世，未調化者其敷無量。
translation: When the life span is short, the Tathāgata appears in the world; those who are not disciplined will have an immeasurable amount of space.

source_sentence: 涅槃將至，我不受王盡形供給。」
translation: When nirvāṇa is about to arrive, I won't accept the king's offering in full form.

source_sentence: 王復白言：「大德世尊！
translation: The king then said, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若不受我盡形供養，唯願慈悲，受我七年，乃至七月七日供養。」
translation: If you don't accept my offerings in full form, please be compassionate and accept them for seven years or even seven months or seven days to make offerings.

source_sentence: 佛亦不受。
translation: The Buddha also doesn't accept it.

source_sentence: 王復白佛：「唯願世尊與苾芻僧伽，明日就宮受我微供。」
translation: The king then said to the Buddha, May the Bhagavān and the monks and nuns accept my humble offerings at the palace tomorrow.

source_sentence: 佛作是念：「不受王請，其王必定口吐熱血因此命終。」
translation: The Buddha thought, Not accepting the king's invitation, that king will surely spit hot blood out of his mouth and die as a result.

source_sentence: 佛便默受王請。
translation: The Buddha then remained silent and accepted the king's invitation.

source_sentence: 王知受已，頂禮佛足，奉辭還宮，勅諸臣曰：「卿等有何巧計，令此眾饌，
translation: Knowing that they had accepted the food, the king bowed his head at the Buddha’s feet and withdrew to the palace. He instructed his officials, “What do you think you should be skilled in calculating how many kinds of food this assembly could eat?

source_sentence: 佛及僧伽明日食盡？」
translation: The Buddha and the saṃgha will finish eating tomorrow?

source_sentence: 諸臣答言：「可布地上，請佛僧伽於上蹈過，亦同如食。」
translation: The ministers replied, You can spread it on the ground and invite the Buddha and Saṃgha to walk up there, just like eating.

source_sentence: 王言：「甚善！」
translation: The king said, Very good!

source_sentence: 王於其夜，辦種種微妙清淨香饌，百味充備。
translation: On that night, the king prepared various subtle and pure delicacies of a hundred flavors.

source_sentence: 眾中有一老出家者，情懷瞋恨：「此無道王，於三月日請佛世尊及苾芻僧伽，
translation: In the assembly, there was an elderly renunciant monk who became angry and said, “This king of the non-Buddhist Way invited the Bhagavān and the bhikṣusaṃgha on the third day of the month.

source_sentence: 令食麁麥。
translation: He told them to eat millet and wheat.

source_sentence: 今現此食，馳逞巧能。」
translation: Now, this food is presented as a show of skillfulness.

source_sentence: 便以脚撥，散其飲食。
translation: He then picked it up with his feet and scattered the food and drink.

source_sentence: 諸婆羅門長者見共譏恥：「聖者！
translation: When the elders of the Brāhmaṇas saw this, they all ridiculed him, saying, Sage!

source_sentence: 此食口飡之物，何容脚撥？」
translation: How can this food that's eaten, mouthed, and devoured be allowed to be picked up by the feet?

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻以緣白佛，佛作是念：「由彼苾芻以脚撥食，有斯過失。
translation: The monks then reported this to the Buddha for his sake, and he thought, That monk's fault is that he uses his feet to deny food.

source_sentence: 從今已後，不應如是入口之物以脚蹈之。
translation: From now on, you shouldn't thus touch it with your feet with an entrance object like this.

source_sentence: 若犯者，得越法罪。」
translation: If someone violates it, they'll be guilty of transgressing the Dharma.

source_sentence: 時火授王見眾坐定，王自行食，皆使飽滿。
translation: When King火授 saw the crowd sitting in meditation, the king ate on his own and made them all fill up.

source_sentence: 飯食將畢，收鉢器，淨澡漱已，取小卑座，對佛前坐。
translation: When the meal was about to end he put away his almsbowl, rinsed it clean, and then took a humble seat in front of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛復為王廣說妙法，從座而去。
translation: The Buddha again explained the wonderful Dharma in detail for the king, and departed from his seat.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻夏安居竟，洗浣衣已，各執衣鉢，悉來佛所，頂禮佛足，在一面立，
translation: At the end of the summer retreat, having washed their clothes and cleansed them, they each took their robes and bowls and came to the Buddha. Having saluted him by bowing their foreheads at his feet, they stood to one side.

source_sentence: 共白佛言：「大德世尊！
translation: They all said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我等在此，於三月日夏安居竟，所有草菴可毀破不？」
translation: We're here, so can we destroy all the grass and bushes that we have at the end of the summer retreat on the third day of the month?

translation: As explained in the fourth chapter of the Incremental Abhidharma, it's explained in detail.

translation: After three incalculable great kalpas, he relinquished his head, eyes, hands, and feet, extensively practiced almsgiving, and became perfectly enlightened.

translation: Kauṣṭhila Śāriputra and Mahāmaudgalyāyana received the marvelous offerings of heaven.

translation: The Buddha told the monks, In the past, I created this action myself, but now I'll accept it for myself.

source_sentence: 廣如餘說。
translation: It's explained in detail as elsewhere.

source_sentence: 「假令經百劫，　　所作業不亡；
translation: Even if it were to pass for a hundred eons, Their deeds wouldn’t perish.

translation: When the causes and conditions meet, the result is returned to be experienced on its own.

translation: This verse then said, You should know!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔，人壽八萬四千歲時，有佛世尊出現於世，號毘鉢尸如來、應供、正覺，
translation: In ancient times, when the human life span was eighty-four thousand years in length, a buddha named Vipaśyin Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One, appeared in the world.

source_sentence: 十號具足。
translation: The ten epithets are complete.

source_sentence: 與八萬四千苾芻眾住親惠城，王都城側。
translation: He was accompanied by eighty-four thousand bhikṣus living in the royal city of Kuśinagara, which was beside the capital city.

source_sentence: 于時親惠城中有一婆羅門，教授五百童子，國中人民尊重供養如真應供。
translation: At the time, there was a Brāhmaṇa in the city of Axiom who taught five hundred children, and the people of the country respected and offered support as they really should be given.

source_sentence: 毘鉢尸如來至彼城邑，國中人民而不恭敬，及不尊重。
translation: When the Tathāgata Vipaśyin arrived in that city, the people of his country didn't respect him or venerate him.

source_sentence: 此婆羅門遂於佛所及聲聞眾，情生嫉妬。
translation: As a result, this Brāhmaṇa became jealous of the Buddha and the śrāvakas.

source_sentence: 時有眾多苾芻學無學，於晨朝時，著衣持鉢入王都城乞食，乞得種種微妙香饌，
translation: At the time, there were many monks who had studied and didn't study. In the morning, they put on their robes and bowls and entered the king's capital city to solicit alms, begging for various kinds of exquisite flavors and delicacies.

source_sentence: 滿鉢而出。
translation: He filled his bowl and came out.

source_sentence: 其婆羅門見已，問曰：『苾芻可來，我觀鉢中乞得何食？』
translation: Seeing this, the Brāhmaṇa asked, 'Come, monk, and let me see what food to beg for in my bowl.'

source_sentence: 是諸苾芻各懷質直，便呈鉢食。
translation: Each of these monks harbored his quality and straightforwardness, so they presented their bowls for food.

translation: They harbored jealousy, became angry, and told the students, 'This is not an offering that should be made; it's unworthy to receive this subtle offering, so you should cause them to give it to him as a great deal of wheat.'

translation: As Upāsaka said, Eat together with wheat.'

translation: Among the crowd, there were two boys with pure faith in their minds and good qualities who said, 'Upādayana!

translation: Don't make such a statement; this is really an offering that should be made, which is endowed with great honor and superiority and capable of being offered by gods, not by talking about human food.'

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「於意云何？
translation: The Buddha told the monks, What do you think?

translation: In the past, wasn't that a different person from the Brāhmaṇas of the past?

source_sentence: 我今是也。
translation: I am now.

source_sentence: 五百學生者，此四百九十八苾芻是。
translation: The five hundred students are these four hundred and ninety-eight bhikṣus.

source_sentence: 其二童子有信心賢善者，今舍利弗及大目連是。
translation: Those two boys who believed in goodness and goodness were Śāriputra and Mahāmaudgalyāyana.

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

translation: Because in the past I harbored jealousy toward the Tathāgata Vipaśyin and his disciples, both those who had more to learn and those who did not.

source_sentence: 彼諸學生悉隨我語；
translation: All those students followed my words.

translation: Because of the power of this action, I am now receiving this retribution.

source_sentence: 是故世尊與四百九十八苾芻食麁馬麥；
translation: That is why the World-Honored One gave these four hundred and ninety-eight bhikṣus food of uncooked barley.

source_sentence: 其舍利弗及大目連，此二童子不隨我語，由善業力，今受天供。
translation: Śāriputra and Mahāmaudgalyāyana, these two boys who didn't follow my words, are now receiving heavenly offerings because of the power of good actions.

source_sentence: 由斯義故，我常宣說：黑業黑報、白業白報、雜業雜報。
translation: Because of this meaning, I always proclaim that black karma has black retribution, white karma has white retribution, and mixed karma has mixed retribution.

source_sentence: 汝等宜應勤修，當如是學。」
translation: It's advisable for you to diligently cultivate it, and you should thus train.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告具壽阿難陀曰：「汝今可來共我詣無能敵城。」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Kauṣṭhila Ānanda, Now, you may come with me to the unrivaled city.

source_sentence: 時阿難陀聞佛教已，即隨佛後，遊行人間，至無能敵國，住弶伽河邊。
translation: After hearing the Buddha's teaching, Ānanda followed him and traveled among the people until he reached the kingdom of Wuxiang and stayed at the edge of the Ganges.

source_sentence: 時有一苾芻來詣佛所，頂禮雙足，在一面立，合掌恭敬，白佛言：「善哉世尊！
translation: A monk then came to the Buddha, bowed his head at his feet, stood to one side, joined his palms in respect, and said to him, Excellent, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 唯願為我，略說妙法。
translation: Please, World-Honored One, give me a brief explanation of the fine dharma.

source_sentence: 我聞勝法，一心領受，勤策懇勵，能為通達。
translation: Having heard the supreme teaching, I wholeheartedly apprehend it; exerting myself energetically and earnestly, I can comprehend it.

source_sentence: 由斯事故，我捨豪族，剃除鬚髮，身服袈裟，捨俗家計而為出家，至終願求無上梵行，
translation: For this reason I renounced the householder’s life, shaved my hair and beard, donned a monastic robe, renounced domestic life, and became a renunciant. At long last I wished to practice the highest path of religion.

source_sentence: 以自有智，得法見法，自利利他。
translation: Because of their own knowledge, they attain the view of the Dharma and see the Dharma for their own benefit and for the benefit of others.

source_sentence: 我生已盡、梵行成立、所作已辦、不受後有。」
translation: My birth has ended, the religious practice has been established, what I've done has been done, and I won't be subject to later existence.

source_sentence: 時此苾芻作斯語已，佛迴顧視觀弶伽河，見於河中有大方梁隨流而下。
translation: After this monk had said these words, the Buddha looked back over the Ganges and saw a large square bridge running downstream in the river.

source_sentence: 見已，告彼苾芻曰：「汝今見此河中方梁，隨水流不？」
translation: When he saw it, he told the monk, Do you see the bridge on the middle of this river running along with the water?

source_sentence: 答言：「已見。」
translation: He replied, I've seen it.

translation: The Buddha said: Suppose there is a monk who does not dwell on the other shore, or on this shore, or on the middle course of the sandy river.

source_sentence: 人不撈出、非人不持、不入漩渦、不壞不爛，不久之間至大海中而為居止。
translation: People don't salvage it, don't carry it by non-people, don't enter into the whirlpool, and don't break or rot it; they soon reach the ocean and abide there as their abode.

source_sentence: 苾芻如是，不住彼此，廣說乃至，到於涅槃。」
translation: A monk like this doesn't abide with each other and explains it in detail until he reaches nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 時此苾芻白佛言：「大德！
translation: The monk then said to the Buddha, Mañjuśrī!

translation: I don't know how to understand each other's shore, even if it doesn't break down or rot.

translation: The Buddha told Śāriputra, There's no place for a joyful herdsman to stay at home and experience the five pleasures of desire.

translation: Having entrusted it to the cow, you should come and see for yourself.

translation: The king told his ministers, 'Should you please strike the drum and proclaim an order that the great king make a great unobstructed offering assembly?'

translation: All the people within the boundary who need anything will come to receive food and give it as alms.'

source_sentence: 諸臣受令已，嚴飾施場，須食者與食、須衣者與衣。
translation: After receiving the order, the ministers adorned the site of giving with food for those who needed food and clothing for those who needed clothing.

source_sentence: 滌米泔水成大壕坑，汎漲流溢，名曰無熱池。
translation: It washes the rice and millet water into a large moat, which rises up and flows over. The lake is called No Heat Pond.

source_sentence: 經於十二年中，米泔飯汁共為湊聚，汎流成河，是故世人號為漿水河。」
translation: For twelve years, rice and rice juice were collected together into a river of rice and rice, and it flowed widely to form a river; therefore, the people called it the River of Milk and Water.

source_sentence: 是時世尊遊至童長城中，告具壽阿難陀曰：「時有國王，生長此城，名曰長淨，
translation: At that time the World-honored One sojourned in the city of Changchong. He said to Ānanda, “There was once a king named Changjing who lived in this city and called it Changjing.

source_sentence: 是故此城號為象聲。」
translation: That's why this city is called elephant sound.

source_sentence: 次至頞伽儞迦城，住在一邊。
translation: Next, he went to the city of Nāgârjuna and stayed on one side.

source_sentence: 佛便微笑，廣說四佛化緣事迹。
translation: The Buddha then smiled and extensively explained the deeds and traces of the four buddha-transformations.

source_sentence: 次至施寶城，告具壽阿難陀曰：「菩薩往昔而於此處施多珍寶，是故此城名為施寶。」
translation: Next, he went to the city of giving treasures and told Kauṣṭhila Ānanda, In the past, the bodhisattva gave many rare treasures here; therefore, this city was called the city of giving treasures.

source_sentence: 次至娑羅力樹，住在一邊，佛便微笑，亦復廣說四佛化迹。
translation: Next, he went to the salā power tree and stayed at one side. The Buddha smiled and explained in detail the traces of the four buddhas’ magical creations.

source_sentence: 次至金升城，告阿難陀曰：「於此城中，菩薩昔時為檀施會，以升量金奉施乞者，
translation: When he arrived at the city of raising gold, he told Ānanda, “In this city the Bodhisattva formerly gave almsgiving to beggars with a raised amount of gold.

source_sentence: 是故此城世號金升。」
translation: That's why this city is called Jinsheng in the world.

source_sentence: 次至自來城，告阿難陀曰：「此自來城，有王名曰長淨，以法化世，人民熾盛，
translation: Then he came to the city of his own country and said to Ānanda, “There is a king named Changjing in the city of my own country. He governs the world according to the Dharma and his people are prosperous.

source_sentence: 豐樂安穩。
translation: It's abundant, pleasant, and stable.

source_sentence: 後於異時，其王頂上遂生肉疱，柔軟如綿而無妨惱。
translation: At another time, a blister of flesh appeared on the king's head, as soft and supple as cotton without obstruction.

source_sentence: 疱成熟破，遂生一子，形容端正顏色殊妙，深可愛樂，廣如餘說。
translation: When the blisters matured and broke out, he gave birth to a child whose appearance was graceful and pleasing, as described in detail elsewhere.

source_sentence: 諸根具足，是故人皆號曰頂生。
translation: Their faculties are fully endowed, so they're all called the top birth.

source_sentence: 時有六萬婇女生後入宮，諸女見已乳皆流出，咸言：『我養！
translation: Sixty thousand lustful women then entered the palace, and when they saw them, their milk all flowed out, and they all said, 'I'll nourish it!'

source_sentence: 我養！』
translation: I nourish!'

source_sentence: 是故號為樂養。
translation: Therefore, it's called blissful nourishment.

source_sentence: 而今有人，亦云頂生，或云樂養。
translation: Now, some people also say it's produced from the top of the head, or they may say it's blissful.

source_sentence: 頂生成大，長淨遂患，以根華葉藥種種醫療而不能痊，病加困重。
translation: The top of the head grows large and becomes long-lastingly pure as a result of illness, which can't be cured by various medicines such as roots, flowers, leaves, or medicines, and the illness is even more serious.

source_sentence: 王告諸臣：『宜速將頂生，為我冊立。』
translation: The king told his ministers, 'Should you quickly give birth to the top of your head and establish a book for me?'

source_sentence: 諸臣啟王：『如王教勅。』
translation: The ministers asked the king, 'Thus is the king's command.'

source_sentence: 即差勅使，令取頂生。
translation: He then sent an envoy to take the top of his head and make it grow.

source_sentence: 長淨大王患苦纏身，奉勅令喚，宜速急赴，欲為冊立。
translation: The great king Changjing suffered from the bondage of suffering and was compelled to be summoned by imperial edict. It is advisable for him to go there as quickly as possible, in order to keep a record of his journey.

source_sentence: 頂生未至，王便命過。
translation: Before he reached the top of his head, the king ordered him to do so.

source_sentence: 復差一使人，報頂生曰：『父王已崩，願見速至。』
translation: Again, he sent an envoy and reported to the top of his head, saying, 'My father has died, so I'd like to see him quickly.'

source_sentence: 頂生作念：『父王既崩，我何須去？』
translation: The topknot thinks, 'Now that my father has died, why should I go?'

source_sentence: 念已便迴，諸臣復差使：『太子當來紹繼父位。』
translation: After he thought this, he turned back, and the ministers again sent an envoy, saying, 'The prince will inherit his father's throne in the future.'

source_sentence: 頂生報曰：『我有王分，在此便為。』
translation: The top of the head replied, 'I have the king's share, so here it is.'

source_sentence: 諸臣啟言：『若冊立王，須多禮備寶堂浴池、師子之座、傘蓋頭冠，於大都城合冊立王，
translation: The ministers said, “If you wish to appoint a king, you should prepare the jeweled halls, bathing pools, lion seats, umbrellas, canopies, headdresses, and crowns for your majesty.

source_sentence: 可來於此。』
translation: You can come here.'

source_sentence: 報曰：『我若為法王者，如此之物，不求自來。』
translation: He replied, 'If I were the king of the Dharma, such things wouldn't come from me.'

source_sentence: 時有藥叉名曰作日，常隨頂生，所遣皆作，便持寶池師子之座、傘蓋頭冠、王都大城，
translation: At that time there was a yakṣa named Producer of the Sun called Producer, who always produced whatever he wished. He produced all the offerings and took the lion seat in the jeweled pond, the umbrella, the canopy, the head crown, and the great city of the king’s capital.

source_sentence: 自然移來。
translation: They naturally come and go.

translation: That's why this city is called its own comet.
